data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you cannot take backwards steps. To take backwards steps, you must first take forwards steps and then take right steps. Therefore, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person going around takes at least four steps and is done with one step. If you go back to the beginning point, taking four steps is the same as turning around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person turns around to return to the starting point. All directions from the beginning to the starting point are back to the same place. One has to turn around for 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left and take 5 steps to get back to the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps back to the starting point. Taking 6 steps back to the starting point involves flipping the coin and changing angles. So, the answer is yes.
